Utterance: Hi! It’s so good to see you again. How did it go with reaching out to potential therapists?
Hi, Ellie! I actually did it! I called one of the therapists, and I have an appointment next week!
That’s fantastic! How did it feel to make that call?
It was nerve-wracking, but I felt really relieved afterward. I think I chose someone who understands PTSD.
That’s great to hear! It’s important to feel comfortable with your therapist. What made you feel that this therapist might be a good fit?
They have experience with trauma and anxiety, and they seemed really compassionate on the phone.
Those are excellent qualities to look for. It’s wonderful that you’re feeling hopeful about this! How have you been feeling overall since we last spoke?
I’ve had some ups and downs, but I’ve been trying to stay positive. The grounding exercises help, but I still have tough days.
It’s completely normal to have fluctuations in how you feel. On those tougher days, what strategies have you found helpful?
I’ve been using the breathing techniques we talked about, and I also try to distract myself with music or video games.
Those sound like effective coping strategies! Music can be a great way to lift your mood. Have you discovered any new songs or artists that resonate with you lately?
Yeah! I found this artist who sings about overcoming struggles, and it really speaks to me.
That’s wonderful! Music can be such a powerful tool for healing. Have you had any moments where you felt particularly proud of yourself since we last met?
I think just making the call to the therapist. It felt like a big step.
That’s a huge accomplishment! You should definitely celebrate that. What are some ways you can reward yourself for this progress?
Maybe I could treat myself to a nice meal or go shopping with my grandma.
Those sound like great ideas! It’s important to acknowledge your achievements, no matter how small. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I guess I’m still worried about how the first session will go.
That’s understandable. First sessions can feel intimidating. Would it help to prepare some topics you want to discuss with your new therapist?
Yeah, I think that would help.
You might want to talk about your experiences with PTSD and how it affects your daily life, as well as your goals for therapy.
Okay, I can write that down.
Great! And remember, it’s okay to take your time in sharing your story. You don’t have to share everything in one session.
That makes sense. I’ll try to keep that in mind.
Good! You’re doing a great job of advocating for yourself. As we wrap up, how are you feeling about the progress you’ve made?
I feel proud of myself. I’m starting to believe that I can really work through this.
That’s an incredible mindset to have! Keep holding onto that belief. Let’s check in next week to see how your appointment goes.
Sounds good! Thank you, Ellie.
You’re welcome! Take care, and I look forward to hearing all about it.
Bye!
Bye!
